Title: Proof of Cauchy's Beta Integral $\int_{-\infty}^\infty \frac{dt}{(1+it)^x(1-it)^y}$
Content: The Cauchy's Beta Integral is given by $$\int_{-\infty}^\infty \frac{dt}{(1+it)^x(1-it)^y}=\frac{\pi 2^{2-x-y}\Gamma(x+y-1)}{\Gamma(x)\Gamma(y)}$$ I would like to know how it is proved.
